intro: Maytenus hookeri var. longiradiata, commonly known as the long-rayed mayten, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its woody structure and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
